topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557bb306636872575e000edf#post_557bb306636872575e000edf

That's kind of tricky in my opinion because 'slashers' as we know it were originally a sub-genre if you can call them that, of horror movies at the time in an attempt to do something new that no one had seen before or wasn't as common in films.

In a sense seems horror has merged all those (Psychological, thriller, suspense, etc.) into one single product because every horror movie has tried (that being the key word) of fitting/cramming as much of them in their runtime.

topics.body:
Although the 2003 anime did do some pretty cool things.
I actually thought the idea of Homonculi being the by-product of failed Human Transmutations was  really interesting. And Envy being Ed and Al's pseudo brother was a neat twist.
